data.title: Nice Place Once You're Past the Facade
data.text:
I am so thankful that other commenters here mentioned that the outside of this place is not representative of the interior and the food! I might have turned around and left without that information. (Note to owners: It sure would help your business if you washed the front windows and straightened the blinds! It doesn't look like you use that patio, but it doesn't enhance the appearance of the restaurant.)

As it was, this is a very nice restaurant with friendly service and wonderful food, rivaling what I get in my hometown (which is excellent for Thai, surprisingly!) The fresh rolls were the biggest, fattest I've ever had, and the brown sauce for them was very nice without being overly sweet. My stir fry main course was very nice as well, and I had plenty to take home for a snack the next day. I'll happily return the next time I'm in this part of Utah.

data.title: Loved It!!
data.text:
We ordered the small sampler and it was amazing!! I ordered the Lad Nah and was a little skeptical when it came because it looked like a big bowl of soup.  However, it was excellent!!  I even had leftovers for the next day.   My husband ordered the Pork Drunken Noodles very spicy and he said it was delicious and it was actually spicy!  
Can't wait to go back and try another dish!  We found a new Thai restaurant close to home!!

data.title: authentic and reasonably priced
data.text: This Thai place did not disappoint.  We enjoyed our Pad Thai noodles and hot chicken basil.  Everything was tasty and fairly priced

data.title: Super Thai food in an unlikely location.
data.text: Great Thai in Layton?  Really?  Really.  We had lunch here and it was excellent.  The lunch specials are very generous.  The service was fine, if a bit slow, and friendly.  The building was a little run down, part of the charm?, but clean.  My partner had the green curry and it was super.  Definitely a go to place in Layton.

data.title: A hidden authentic gem
data.text: I'm Thai and have lived in Thailand for about 10 years. I've also lived in the States for about 10+ years. I've tried probably close to 15 different Thai restaurants in many different states. This by far, is THE most authentic restaurant and the best testing Thai food I've ever come across. And in Layton, UT of all places! Love this place! Get their Panang Curry, it'll be the best you'll ever have. Get the Pad Mee Korat, which personally for me, is far better than any old Pad Thai you can get. And the icing on the cake is, it is VERY well priced.

data.title: Great Thai food restaurant, amazing massaman
data.text:
As mentioned in other reviews this is located in an old and kind of run-down building on main street that has housed quite a few ultimately unsuccessful businesses. Don't be scared away by the building.

The food here is amazing. It was recommended to us by some friends and we love it. We have probably eaten here 10 times. Well, we have never actually eaten here. We always just call in our order and then pick it up.

We ate the food once with someone who used to live in Thailand and he said it is some of the best Thai food he has had in the US.

The massaman here is amazing. I have since tried it at some other restaurants and it isn't nearly as good as it is here. I also like the green curry and we always get some pad thai.

data.title: Don't be deceived by the exterior building
data.text:
I've been just craving good Thai since we moved to Utah. The reviews looked good so we placed a to go order and gave this place a try. Reviews are right, this place looks run down on the outside, but don't let it discourage you.

We started with the pork won tons. I didn't love them because I thought they were too crunchy but my husband liked them.

The green curry was fantastic! So many layers of flavor. Seriously, some of the best curry I've ever had!

My husband had the Pad Me Korat with Pork and liked it. He said the sauce was somewhat sweet.

The prices are reasonable. I got 2 meals out of my order so portions are generous. We'll be back!

data.title: Closest to Thailand in Utah
data.text: I have ordered my favorite dishes (Yum Woon Sen, and Panang Curry) at every Thai restaurant from St. George to Logan and this place is the only one that reminds me of Bangkok.

data.title: Tasty Thai!
data.text: Family owned Thai food restaurant with an extensive menu.  I chose a curry which was very good, my partner decided on a noodle dish which lacked in flavor profile, but was freshly prepared.  Excellent friendly service and reasonable.

data.title: Great Thai food
data.text: Great Thai food.  Very good service.  Very clean.  The curry is excellent as is the pad thai.  I was very pleased with the sauces as well.

data.title: Good food
data.text:
The food and service was great,  guys in my shop said check it out.  Good call fellas!!
Will go back for sure,  as I have said before don't judge a book by its cover.  You will miss out on a great story.  Go and Enjoy!!

data.title: Delightfully Delicious
data.text: Pad Pew Wan is excellent! Also the chicken fried rice is very tasty!!!! Very friendly people. The building is older but clean. Haven't had a bad meal here!

data.title: Close Your Eyes and You are in Heaven
data.text:
In a sea of cookie cutter chain restaurants, Thai Rod Dee is a hidden island of authentic Thai food, bringing culture and an interesting flair to an otherwise boring food scene in Layton.
Granted, the dilapidated building and location on main street leave much to be desired for atmosphere, but the food choices and quality make up for it.
There is a slight language gap between the staff and customer, but again, I think that lends to the authenticity of the food and overall experience. 
I had the Panang (which is my all time favorite curry) and it was very good. I requested medium spicy (because if you know authentic Thai, medium could light a rocket) and it was just right for my spicy taste buds.
The rest of the family got different Pad dishes (Pad Thai, Pad see ew, and Pad Kee Mao), all of which were stellar (I tasted all of them).
The service was great, but we were also one of only two tables that were occupied in the mid afternoon on a Thursday. 
I sincerely hope this gem gets the business it deserves so that it will stay around for years to come.  It's sad that boring chain restaurants around town get packed and you had to wait for an hour to be seated, while truly amazing food restaurants like Thai Rod Dee get overlooked.

data.title: Fairly Good Food - If The Building Doesn't Scare You Off!!!
data.text:
Wanted some spicy food while visiting Layton. Parking lot was somewhat busy so we figured, why not. The building was obviously another business/cuisine at one time. Once inside, UGH ... kindda worn down, dark and scary. When the sign for the bathroom & kitchen is handwritten on a page taken from a yellow letter/legal-sized pad, it makes you wonder if this is the place you really want to be! We decided to stick it out.

Service was slow since there was only one person working the restaurant portion doing greeting, cashier, waitress, water refills, etc. (Poor lady was running tho!) I really liked the menu where everything is pictured and explained...Very sensible!!! We finally ordered and food came rather quickly. It was pretty good and had a nice spice, fresh and hot! To be very fair...The quality is really good, portion size is large and the price extremely reasonable! You can see they are making a go at this business! I would visit them again to see if they have improved when in the area again! Really hope they do well if they are just starting out!!!

data.title: Pretty Good
data.text: Love that their menus all have a picture for each meal. The food was good and of good quality. Our waiter was kind and quick. The food was hot and tasty! Not the best Thai food I have had, but pretty good.

data.title: Great service and food!
data.text: Our food was very good! The exterior and interior need a major renovation but other than that it is very good.

data.title: Excellent Thai Meal
data.text: My family and I have eaten at Thai Rod Dee on several occasions.  Each meal has been fantastic.  We have dined at most of the Thai restaurants in Davis County and SLC, and often eat Thai food while traveling.  The food at Thai Rod Dee compares favorably to all.  Dishes are lightly prepared and beautifully presented.  Contrasting flavors combine to create a delicious whole.  Service is friendly and prompt.  Prices are quite reasonable, especially if you choose to dine family style.  As others have stated, don't let the dated building and decor prevent you from trying the wonderful food that this restaurant offers.

data.title: Better than it looks
data.text: So I know it looks a little old on the outside, but it is very good food. It's pretty close to base and the service was great. Very friendly. We even came in about 30 min until closing and the server was still great.

data.title: Very good food and service
data.text:
The food is amazing. We were in a large party and tried about 8 different dishes and 3 different appetizers. Everthing was amazing!!!

The service is fantastic.
The prices are super reasonable.
The portions are huge.

The decor is dated, but I can put up with that considering the quality of the food.

data.title: Best Thai food in Davis county
data.text: We eat Thai food everywhere we go and this is one of the better Thai restaruants we've ever been to.  We've gone 5 or 6 times now.  The chicken Laab is super good.
